required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Oral Ethanol and Vaped Ethanol on the Evaluation of Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Oral Ethanol and Vaped Ethanol on the Evaluation of Impairment

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to find out about ethanol-containing e-cigarettes impact ethanol breath tests, field sobriety tests, or other tests of sobriety. Ethanol is a common part of e-cigarette liquids.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in preliminary ethanol breath level
primary_outcome.time_frame: Conducted before and after the e-cigarette is used by the participant, at multiple time points (change from baseline reading at 27, 35, 40, 45, and 56 minutes after e-cigarette use)
primary_outcome.description: Preliminary ethanol breath level will be assessed using a probationary breath test or PBT, which involves blowing through a tube.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Conducted before and after the e-cigarette is used by the participant, at multiple time points (change from baseline at 29, 37, 42, 47, and 58 minutes after e-cigarette use)
primary_outcome.description: Secondary type of breath test used (gives percent blood alcohol concentration)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Conducted before and after the e-cigarette is used by the participant, at multiple time points (change from baseline at 30 and 49 minutes after e-cigarette use)

other_outcome.time_frame: Administered after e-cigarette use (at 39 minutes after e-cigarette use)
other_outcome.description: Questionnaire that asks participants about their vaping experience (10 questions, each scored from 0 - 100)

other_outcome.time_frame: Conducted before and after the e-cigarette is used by the participant (change from baseline at 39 and 54 minutes after e-cigarette use)
other_outcome.description: Questionnaire that asks participants about effects associated with alcohol use (14 questions, each scored from 0 - 10)

other_outcome.time_frame: Administered after e-cigarette use (at 39 minutes after e-cigarette use)
other_outcome.description: Questionnaire that asks participants about flavor sensation, harshness/irritancy, and "throat hit" of the e-cigarette (3 questions, each scored from 0 - 100)

arm_group.description: Participants will receive each of the four conditions. Order of conditions will be assigned using a Latin square model.

intervention.intervention_name: Beverage with ethanol and E-cigarette liquid with ethanol
intervention.description: Beverage with ethanol and E-cigarette liquid with ethanol

intervention.intervention_name: Beverage with ethanol and E-cigarette liquid without ethanol
intervention.description: Beverage with ethanol and E-cigarette liquid without ethanol

intervention.intervention_name: Beverage without ethanol and E-cigarette liquid with ethanol
intervention.description: Beverage without ethanol and E-cigarette liquid with ethanol

intervention.intervention_name: Beverage without ethanol and E-cigarette liquid without ethanol
intervention.description: Beverage without ethanol and E-cigarette liquid without ethanol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- e-cigarette users
- willing to provide informed consent
- able to attend the lab sessions as needed
- agree to use designated products according to study protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are breast-feeding or test positive for pregnancy (by urinalysis) at screening.
- Some study details about the eligibility criteria are purposely omitted at this time to preserve scientific integrity. Full details will be posted at the conclusion of the stud
